intro: Peristrophe gracilis, commonly known as slender leaved sedge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Peristrophe gracilis has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
